author: Jacky
title: Qantas criticized for ‘anti-Christian’ act during Christmas season
text:
- Qantas accused of anti-Christian act
- Airline criticized during the Christmas season
Bob Katter has accused Qantas of being anti-Christian after claiming the national airline disparaged traditional carol singing inside one of its prestigious business class lounges.
In a written complaint against the airline, the independent MP said he was angry because he did not listen to Christmas music with religious messages while sitting in a Qantas Club during a flight delay.
“I noticed that during the two hours I was there, they played Christmas music,” Mr. Katter said.
‘Two hours of the least Christmassy music I’ve ever heard.
Bob Katter accused Qantas of being anti-Christian after claiming the national airline rejected traditional Christmas carols inside one of its prestigious business class lounges.
‘More than 80 per cent of Australia’s population are generational Australians and grew up listening to Christmas carols.
“It would seem then that Qantas is anti-Christian.”
According to the most recent census data, there has been a steady decline in the number of Australians identifying as Christian, with overall numbers falling from 74 per cent in 1991 to 44 per cent in 2021.
The same data found that while fewer people identify as Christians, the number of people who claim to have no religion has increased to 38 percent in 2021, up from 30 percent in 2016.
In his pre-Christmas speech, Katter, representing the Kennedy division in Queensland: He then lashed out at former Qantas chief executive Alan Joyce.
In a written complaint against the airline, the independent MP said he was angry because he did not listen to Christmas music with religious messages while sitting in a Qantas Club during a flight delay.
Joyce resigned in early September after the airline came under the spotlight over allegations of illegal ticket sales and poor service.
“As time goes by, I hope more and more Christians will realize their spite,” he wrote.
“So although Alan Joyce (Australia’s most hated man?) may be gone, his ‘spirit’ clearly lives on.
“But one thing is certain: its spirit” is not “The Spirit of Australia.”
Qantas has been contacted for comment.

author: SIPSE.com
title: Tren Maya lanza paquetes turísticos para Semana Santa 2025
text:
Tren Maya lanza paquetes turísticos para Semana Santa 2025
Los paquetes incluyen recorridos por las 34 estaciones y visitas a 29 zonas arqueológicas.
El Tren Maya, uno de los proyectos insignia de infraestructura en México, anunció el lanzamiento de 10 paquetes vacacionales diseñados especialmente para el periodo de Semana Santa 2025. Estas opciones ofrecen a las familias y viajeros la oportunidad de explorar la riqueza cultural y natural del sureste mexicano.
El director general del Tren Maya, Óscar David Lozano Águila, presentó los paquetes durante la conferencia "Mañanera del Pueblo" de este jueves 23 de enero, destacando que los precios de los mismos oscilan entre los 14 mil y 23 mil pesos.
"Debido al éxito que tuvimos con los paquetes promocionados en diciembre, decidimos ofrecer esta alternativa de paseo turístico también en Semana Santa", mencionó Lozano Águila.
Tren Maya ofrecerá 10 paquetes turísticos para Semana Santa
— Político MX (@politicomx)
El general Óscar David Lozano Águila, director general del Tren Maya, presentó los paquetes que permitirán visitar las 29 zonas arqueológicas de la región y distintos parques temáticos; además, todos los paquetes…[pic.twitter.com/eICY1Nq05m][January 23, 2025]
Opciones de paquetes turísticos
Los paquetes incluyen recorridos por las 34 estaciones del Tren Maya y visitas a 29 zonas arqueológicas, además de vuelos saliendo del Aeropuerto Internacional Felipe Ángeles (AIFA) operados por Mexicana de Aviación. Entre los destinos destacados se encuentran Tulum, Mérida, Bacalar, Chetumal y Palenque, con hospedaje incluido en los hoteles del Tren Maya.
Cada paquete tiene un enfoque único, con duraciones que van desde 4 días y 3 noches hasta 6 días y 5 noches. Algunos de los más destacados son:
- Entre Lagunas y Leyendas: Por $14,643, incluye hospedaje, visitas a Bacalar y Tulum, y una duración de 4 días y 3 noches (13 al 16 de abril).
- Entre Pirámides y Palmeras: Por $23,186, ofrece una experiencia de 6 días y 5 noches, recorriendo Mérida, Chichén Itzá y Tulum, con hospedaje en el Hotel Tren Maya Tulum (24 al 29 de abril).
- Mares y Lagunas: Paquete de 4 días y 3 noches (19 al 22 de abril) con un costo competitivo, incluye hospedaje en Tulum y visitas al Fuerte de Bacalar y la Zona Arqueológica de Tulum.
Cómo adquirir los paquetes
Los interesados en disfrutar de estas experiencias pueden solicitar información detallada sobre precios y reservas a través del correo electrónico: [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection). También están disponibles los números de contacto: 55 9558 6292 y 55 4461 7728 para mensajes vía WhatsApp.
Impacto del Tren Maya en el turismo
En 400 días de operación, el Tren Maya ha movilizado a 784 mil 536 personas, siendo Mérida, Cancún y Playa del Carmen las estaciones con mayor afluencia. El director general destacó que, durante el pasado periodo vacacional de invierno, se registraron más de 111 mil boletos vendidos en diciembre, con un promedio diario de 3 mil 608 pasajeros.
"Estos resultados reflejan el impacto positivo del Tren Maya en el turismo del sureste mexicano, y esperamos que los paquetes de Semana Santa superen estas cifras", aseguró Lozano Águila.
Con estas ofertas, el Tren Maya busca posicionarse como una opción atractiva para el turismo nacional e internacional, promoviendo el patrimonio cultural y las bellezas naturales del país.
— Once Noticias (@OnceNoticiasTV)[#MañaneraDelPueblo]| Adolfo Héctor Velasco, director de[#GAFSACOMM], presentó los paquetes turísticos que ofrecieron los Hoteles Tren Maya durante la temporada vacacional:
-Incluyen vuelo.
-Hospedaje.
-Alimentación.
-Visitas a museos, parques, zonas arqueológicas y playas.…[pic.twitter.com/d6R5VpuGIl][January 23, 2025]
Con información de El Universal / Político MX.

author: Rohith Nair
title: Football: Soccer-Iraq stun Japan to seal Asian Cup last-16 spot | The Star
text:
AL RAYYAN, Qatar (Reuters) -Iraq claimed their first victory over Japan in 42 years when they won their Asian Cup Group D encounter 2-1 on Friday to qualify for the knockout stage thanks to a first-half double from Aymen Hussein at the Education City Stadium.
Japan were unbeaten against the West Asian side in their last nine games and Iraq's victory propelled them to the top of the group standings with six points from two games while Hajime Moriyasu's side have three points.
"Today is a great day for Iraqi people but for us it's just a win. We have six points, but the players must now think of Vietnam (in the last group game) and they need to rest," Iraq coach Jesus Casas told reporters.
"I'm very proud of my players. All Iraqi players should be proud... The perfect match is impossible, but we were close to the perfect match I wanted."
Roared on by thousands of Iraqi supporters in the stadium, Iraq got on the board inside five minutes when Japan goalkeeper Zion Suzuki failed to deal with a cross, parrying the ball straight to Hussein who headed it into the top corner.
Iraq's strategy to unsettle Japan was to stay compact and use their physicality early on, which worked to an extent until the East Asian side began using their pace and finding space on the wings to put crosses into the box.
Japan had a golden opportunity to equalise in the 22nd minute from a set piece when a header fell to Wataru Endo at the edge of the six-yard box, but the skipper was unable to direct an overhead kick into the net.
Iraq doubled their lead on the stroke of halftime when Ahmed Al-Hajjaj skipped past his marker and floated in a cross that was headed home from point-blank range by Hussein as the Iraqi fans went delirious.
PENALTY DENIED
But Hussein went down injured just before the break and was replaced for the second half and though Iraqi fans were dejected when their hero did not take the field, they found their voice again when Japan were denied a penalty despite a VAR check.
Moriyasu made five substitutions after the restart but the Samurai Blue rarely tested the keeper until the 94th minute when Endo headed home at the far post from a corner.
The atmosphere was tense in the dying minutes as Japan frantically sought an equaliser but Iraq held on for the three points to move top.
"We prepared the same way as we did for Vietnam but unfortunately we found ourselves in a difficult position, especially early on. The crowd and atmosphere made us feel like we were playing an away game," Moriyasu said.
"The second goal hit us hard, we must learn from our mistakes. The players fought hard and I must accept responsibility for the loss.
"We analysed before the game and knew how Iraq would play at the start, they did play very aggressive. Unfortunately we couldn't handle it, I know we need to do more."
(Reporting by Rohith Nair in Doha; Editing by Ken Ferris and Toby Davis)

author: Aaron White
title: Rochester experiences the warmest December on record | News | kimt.com
text: Rochester, MN (KIMT) -- It's official! December 2023 will go down as the warmest December on record for Rochester. Throughout the month, temperatures trended to be near or above normal. Only one day recorded a high temperature more than 2 degrees below normal. The calendar below shows that a majority of days features high temperatures that were above normal. Overall, the month ended with an average temperature of 31.8°, which is 1.1° higher than the 1931 record of 30.7°. It was also 11.0° warmer than the 30-year average (1991-2020) of 20.8°. According to the National Weather Service in La Crosse, several other daily records were also set during the month of December. - December 16 - Warm Low of 35°F - Tied with 1977 - December 23 - Warm Low of 39°F - Previous Record 33°F in 1982 and 2005 - December 24 - Record High of 52°F - Previous Record 28°F in 2021 - December 24 - Warm Low of 44°F - Previous Record 36°F in 1936 - December 24 - Highest Dew Point of 52°F - Previous record was 41°F in 2021 - December 25 - Record High of 53°F - Previous Record 50°F in 1936 - December 25 - Warm Low of 44°F - Previous Record 38°F in 1936 - December 25 - Highest Dew Point of 52°F - Previous record was 37°F in 2016

author: Cam Jandrow
title: Worcester student makes Easter baskets for homeless children
text:
WORCESTER, Mass. – Joshua Sowden says a firsthand experience opened his eyes to the struggles of being homeless.
"My stepmother's sister was living in a homeless shelter and we went there," Joshua said. "We gave her son an Easter basket, and I asked if the other kids had Easter. She said, 'no, unless they're donated.' And I really wanted to help out."
From that one interaction, Sowden, a sixth-grader in Worcester, has only seen his passion grow. This year will be his fourth handing out baskets to homeless children in the area. What started with one basket to a family member has now grown to an estimated 310 he'll hand out in 2024.
What You Need To Know Worcester sixth-grader Joshua Sowden is handing out Easter baskets to local homeless children
This year, he plans to hand out 310 baskets
His message hits home, as he and his family experienced homelessness last year
Infants through 12 year olds will receive baskets "It feels really nice to know that they're going to enjoy this year," Joshua said.
The young boy's message hit home even more last year, when he and his family were facing homelessness.
"We were told that we had to move, and we ended up in a hotel from the end of April until the week before Christmas," said Joshua's stepmother, Crystal Sowden.
Infants through 12 year olds will receive baskets this year.
When Spectrum News 1 paid Joshua a visit, his living room was reminiscent of a loading dock, with Amazon boxes full of Easter-themed gifts lining the floor.
This year, though, he's getting help from his friend, Jacob.
"One day I came here, and they had all the boxes," said Jacob. "And I was like, "What's up with the boxes?" They told me the story and they asked me if I wanted to help. And I said 'yeah.'"
"It makes me really happy that other people want to be involved in this and help out," responded Joshua.
Joshua will hand out the baskets at two shelters, one in Worcester and the other in Hudson. They'll also be donated to kids living in the hotel Joshua lived in last year.
"Knowing what a difference it's going to give these kids, especially after what we saw last year. Being able to give them a smile, even for a couple hours, is huge," said Crystal Sowden.
They'll hand them out on March 23, hoping to be a beam of light for some who may be in a dark time of their lives.

author: Gerrard Kaonga
title: Movie banned in multiple countries due to extremely graphic sex scenes has been added to Netflix
text: For tonight's Netflix viewing, how about a film with graphic, unsimulated sex scenes which was banned in its native country? Yep, a film that was too full-on to be shown in cinemas is now available to watch at the click of a button, if that sort of thing sounds appealing. This Indian-made film from 2010 was directed by Qaushiq Mukherjee, known as 'Q', who had the vision of creating an abstract film with elements of sex weaved into the storyline. Advert And with anything involving sex in cinema, some people had their reservations. However even the most risqué directors might not have opted for Mukherjee’s decision to include unsimulated sex scenes in his movie. So you can understand why some people got into quite a huff about the film. Since even in the most believable film sex scenes, more often than not the two actors aren’t actually doing the deed. Advert They’ll use crafty camera work to create the illusion. This film? Not so much. The film is called Gandu, which translates to 'a e', and it's now available to stream on [Netflix](https://www.unilad.com/netflix). The film follows a teenage rapper who steals from his mother's lover to fund his love for [drugs](https://www.unilad.com/drugs), all while trying to make it in the [music](https://www.unilad.com/music) industry. There are numerous graphic sex scenes between Gandu’s mother (Kamalika Banerjee) and her lover Dasbabu (Silajit Majumder), which main character Gandu (Anubrata Basu) walks in on. Advert If that wasn’t explicit enough for you, in one of the film’s most controversial scenes, Basu has a fully erect penis in a sex scene with co-star Rii Sen, with Q saying that the pair had real-life sex. What makes it even weirder? Sen was actually in a relationship with Q when they shot the scene. She [told ](https://openthemagazine.com/art-culture/the-candid-killer-of-camera-shyness/)Open magazine: “There were physical workshops that helped us shed our inhibitions and become real. If someone were to touch my boobs, it's natural that I'd be aroused. Advert “But it is the aftermath that is important. How do you feel after such a shoot? I wasn't shattered or anything after I shot Gandu. “I was shooting lovemaking scenes with my co-actor that were being shot by my boyfriend. Now, how weird is that?" You can probably understand at this point why the film may have been viewed as taboo. In India the flick didn’t get its first screening until July 2021 at the Osian Film Festival. But despite the many controversies that have followed the flick over the years, critics have received the film positively as Gandu boasts a decent score of 68 percent on review aggregator website [Rotten Tomatoes.](https://www.unilad.com/rotten-tomatoes) Topics: [Sex and Relationships](/sex-and-relationships), [Film and TV](/film-and-tv)

author: MENAFN
title: Meghan Trainor Was Told That Parenthood Would End Her Career
text:
( MENAFN - IANS) Los Angeles, Jan 31 (IANS) Grammy winner Meghan Trainor, who has Riley and 18-month-old Barry with husband Daryl Sabara, recalled being warned that her career would come to an end if she had children because "nobody really cares" about mothers in the music industry.
She told People magazine:“Once they got pregnant, they were like, 'You're done.' I was told at 20 by an older gentleman in the industry, 'Well, she's a mom, so nobody really cares.' I was like, 'Ouch!'”
However, the 'Dear Future Husband' hitmaker believes her career has gained "a whole new life" since having her sons.
She said:“When I became a mom, my career had a whole new life. I had a whole reboot, and it's because my kids made me want to be the best version of me. I'm not peaking. I've just begun.”
She took her children on the road when she toured last year and it was a great experience for the whole family, reports co.
She recalled:“I'd be fully glammed up, picking boogies, putting diapers on, putting them in their pyjamas before a show. My glitter would be leaking on them; I would peel eyelashes off them all the time, but they loved it.
“Nobody misses it more than Riley. Every day he's like, 'Can we go back on tour?'”
Trainor is thrilled with how her life has turned out, she admitted there is still one thing she is hoping for - "some daughters".
She said:“Where I am right now is far beyond anything I could have ever dreamed of. I always wanted a family. Check. Now I need some daughters. But I never thought I could be a pop star because I didn't believe in myself.
"Now 19-year-old Meghan putting out 'All About that Bass' is stoked; she's so proud, like, 'I didn't know you could do that.' It took 10 years to become brave, but I'm finally thriving.”
The 'All About That Bass'' singer doesn't worry about her sales figures or chart performance because all that matters is that her kids "love" her work.
She said: "Priorities shifted [when I became a mom]. It's like, 'What charts? My kids love this.' At night when we're doing bath time, I'm like, 'Want to hear Mommy's new song?' Getting to talk to my older son now, I'll ask, 'What does Mommy do?' He's like, 'She's a pop star.' Like, yeah, Mommy's cool!”
MENAFN30012025000231011071ID1109151296
